author: Special Correspondent
text:
Traffic on the First Line Beach Road in Nagapattinam would be diverted from March 14 to facilitate the construction of a bridge by Railways, Collector S. Palanisamy said.

The following diversions would be enforced:

All vehicles heading towards Tiruvurar and Velankanni from Nagapattinam would be diverted via Headquarters Hospital, Anna Statue, Sir Ahmed Street, Neela Street South, Naduvar Keezha Veedhi and Perumal Kovil South Street. Vehicles coming in the opposite direction should go via Puthur Roundabout, Kottai Vasal and Devi Theatre to reach the new bus stand.

Two-wheelers and light vehicles coming towards Nagapattinam from the Akkarapettai side should go via Salt Road, Keechankuppam Road, Keeraikollai Street, and Perumal Kovil South Street.

In the opposite direction, the vehicles would go via Perumal Kovil South Street, Chekkadi Street, Keechankuppam Road, and Salt Road.

For the benefit of residents between Akkaraipettai and Velankanni, TNSTC buses would be operated from Akkarapettai Thonithurai to Velankanni, Mr. Palanisamy said in a release.
title: Traffic diversion in Nagapattinam
